One of the greatest thing working here is that you see different animals on a daily and the not so good days were the smells occasionally but other than that it was perfect

My coworkers were the best part of working for this company. It's not an awful place to work, however, I don't understand where they find managers from. I was consistently lied to about my pay, and job security during COVID. A girl that had been working there for 3 months was receiving higher pay than me for the same job when I had been there for 3 years. I was in-valued as an employee and the lack of integrity is unacceptable in management. I had an awful experience in the last month I stayed with this company. Take everything they say with a grain of salt. They will tell you what you want to hear just to get you off their back and then never deliver.

They are sexiest, only small females work they. They put you in uncomfy situations and make you work 13 hour shift. Customers are allowed to walk all over you. They do not care about ethical values, overall it's like 4/10. Nothing  is ever enough for them.
Management is very supportive and helpful when you are a hard worker. Will help you advance in the company. Pay can be better for the job requirements.
I can't speak for all petsmarts but i adore the one i work at. The managers are nice and try their best to work with me so i am not burnt out every shift.

I had been with Petsmart for nearly two years as a bather/stylist apprentice. Before I was even hired, I expressed my interest and desire to go to their grooming academy, in order to become a groomer/pet stylist. Managment at both stores I have worked at has been unsupportive, and unprofessional. If you want to become a groomer, you are better off going elsewhere and training on the job, as opposed to waiting for petsmart to send you to their academy.

Working here I can honestly say they do not pay you nearly enough for the work you do. This is not a good job if you’re not comfortable being in the store completely by yourself. You get payed $10 an hour to do a million things in one night and also handle health charts and monitoring sick animals. You are responsible with 40 animals on the weekend and more if it’s closer to the holidays. The managers are extremely unprofessional and they aren’t understanding at all. They tell you if you’re not comfortable walking animals then don’t, your safety comes first however when you tell them you weren’t comfortable they are mad at you? They are so busy telling you the things you didn’t do right in the morning and never tell you the things you do very good at. It’s extremely discouraging. This is really funny considering they don’t do much and they sit around till the store opens. The closers leave you with messes at night when you come in even though they are supposed to have majority of things done so you can focus on your duties however they never seem to do them. They leave me with tons of laundry and dishes as well as five or more dogs sitting in their room with accidents. This place is also infested with giant cockroaches that are around the dogs. Working here i’ve learned two things: 1) I will never take my dog here 2) I am worth so much more than this job. Guys, I’ve worked plenty of jobs and this job payed me the least out of all of them and I did the most work here. This job is worth $15+ so if you do decide to work here I suggest working in a different department because they

The majority of my customers were fantastic, there were just the few who wouldn’t listen to my vast knowledge of animals and didn’t believe me when I told them about the work, effort, and MONEY that goes in to any and every pet. Not to mention the condition some of our animals came in (don’t look up Petsmart animal suppliers, it’s awful). The managers were horrid. I was the lowest manager and I had to do everyone else’s job and anytime I tried to help the unappreciated employees with something I got fussed at. The distract manager only cares about promoting men and if you even question why things are done a certain way way you’re written off as not following policy. They allow sexist and racist managers to work there knowingly and after multiple employees and customers have pointed it out. You’re required to have open availability (basically on all 24/7) and if you try and change it for a second job, school, or even religious stuff you are fussed at, overruled, or challenged on the validity of your reasons. And good luck getting full time, they’ll work you like you’re full time and expect you to be available like you’re full time but as soon as you start getting to that average hours you’re suddenly down to working once or twice a week. Also they pay terribly. I’d run far away!! I would give negative stars if possible.
Liked my time here! Good job during high school. Managers were fair and understanding. I enjoyed working with a variety of people and also helping customers when they had questions.

While I worked at the hotel, I started out really excited! Who doesn't want to work with dogs all day?? The truth was it was very stressful-- constantly understaffed and overworked. We had a terrible turnover rate, the manager would hire a few new people and most of them would only last a month before quitting because of the stress.

Great part time job.  The managers are helpful and the animals are fun.  It can get stressful as corporate will try to cut costs by cutting hours which then upsets customers when lines get long.  Normal retail issues.
It was a stressful job at best that didn't pay for the work they wanted done. The employees I worked with were all great people and I enjoyed coming in every day to work expecting something new.

The culture in my store was great, everyone got along well for the most part. However we could not keep a store leader (SL) or assistant store leader (ASL) for longer than a few months, most likely because of difficult upper management who aimed to instill fear in leaders rather than inspiring them, asking for input, or offering assistance/guidance. This does not seem to be the case for all districts, but this one specifically.
Management does not equally distribute hours. The same employees stay with 8 hours a week, while others enjoy 30, and this has nothing to do with availability.

My experience at PetSmart.  The employees are welcoming, concerning, and supportive.  The schedule is flexible.  I learned a variety of skills needed for the store to be successful.  the management encourages employee success.  The workplace and culture is fantastic.The hardest part of the job was when I tried to work as a groomer.  I was not successful at that so the manager found what I was successful at.  The most enjoyable part of the job was the interaction with customers.

This was a great place to work as a part-time job. Definitely high-paced and busy through the holidays. Definitely needs to have an empathetic person who is willing to listen to pet parents talk about their animals.

Best job I’ve ever had. It was laid back (most of the time) and I loved everyone I worked with. You saw the cutest animals—from puppies to leopard geckos. You would get some strange customers with strange request, people would expect you to solve their problems with their pet when they should go to a VET. Price matching was a nightmare. But overall a great experience.

I didn't start/stay for pay...I truly LOVE animals so the job was great to me in that aspect. My personal opinion is that they should offer more compensation/hours to associates. Employees deal with alot when it comes to PetParents and even WITH proof otherwise...corporate tends to believe every word a customer says in complaint. If thin skin...not the job for you

The management staff is unprofessional. You can do a good job however if they have created in their mind that they do not like you. Figure it out what goes on. I am not being bitter.  I just do not think the dogs are properly cared for.
It's a good job, some of the the groomers are nice and the animals are great to work with once you're trained.

Managers change frequently, employees bigger between one another and cause unnecessary drama between one another. Training was bad for grooming, had to get 3 did teachers with 3 different styles of work to teach a group of students in 2 weeks. Very difficult to get basics if trainers and managers keep quitting. To get a good check you would have to fight each other to get bookings.
I liked working there my co workers were very nice and would help if I needed it. It would get very busy around the afternoon but thats the best part.

This company was one of the worst companies I have every worked for. They really suck with scheduling, letting you know if they have changed the schedule. They also do not do competitive pay. And pay there employees nothing. I hated working with this company.

There’s not enough time to list everything wrong with this location when I worked there.  Overall it’s a fun job but management absolutely ruins it.  There may be different management now but when I was there it was awful.  And when I filed a complaint with corporate they “listened” to my complaint but then did nothing about it and the management I complained about retaliated.  I worked in the hotel, out in the store, and as one of the trainers.  I would have continued working there if it wasn’t for the management.  Also they do the thing that should be completely illegal of giving me JUST under 40 hours so I wouldn’t qualify for benefits.  And then they would yell at me if I crossed into overtime pay after THEY called me in.  Also the pay was awful.  I’m pretty sure it was minimum wage and each quarter you could get a .25 raise.  You read that right, TWENTY FIVE CENT RAISE.  They also started out not giving me my legally required 15 minute breaks, meanwhile one of the managers would take smoke breaks about 10 times per shift.  I really do miss all the dogs I saw on a regular basis though.  And some of the pet parents were great and I miss them as well.

Pet Care Associate at Petsmart was my first job and for a first job, it was great. My only complaint is that the animals are often seen as inventory. I had one manager throw dead bearded dragons at me. Not all managers will be that harsh.

If you work the hotel be ready for 8 hours straight in a room with 10-12 dogs by yourself with no bathroom breaks or safety except for a small citronella can. Employees have to go into every room regardless if they get bit and sent to the hospital. You also are paid base pay for making sure yourself and people's dogs don't die or kill each other.
You can always learn something here. Have open hours for working and you can almost get full time work. There great people to work for and I've learned a lot from them.
Love the people and pets! Learning something new everyday was normal. The chance to move up was easy. Overall great company with great benefits! All for the love of pets
It was fun but cashier was not for me.  Managers were kind and considerate. Always continuing education on products and interaction with venders.   Stable job to work at

I was very happy there until covid19 laid us off! If you love dogs like I do, then you will be satisfied. Everything was fun when it came to play rooms. Only problem was breaking up a dog fight! It's quite the adrenalin!

The animals were poorly housed when I got there. There was dust and cat hair so thick that it'd choke you. Some of the cats had fleas or other issues that hadnt been taken care of. The cats would also fight often because they were overcrowded

I enjoyed my 6 years at the Petshotel at Petsmart . I learned many things and enjoyed being with  the dogs . I treated each dog like it was my own . In turn I felt like the dogs and their family were like my own family .
I like shopping here. Not enough employees to help high prices.  I never can find someone to get crickets for me. When they call for someone noone shows up. Always understaffed

I was a leader at my store within a month of being hired. What I wasn't prepared for was the constant drama within management. My store leader and assistant store leader constantly degraded other employees and talked negatively about them. It wasn't a professional environment. I never received any support from my store leader. During my six years I witnessed many great employees being run off by poor upper management.
I liked grooming dogs, everyone loves dogs, and it's cool to transform them and make them feel good! I really did love it. But my manager made the work environment hostile for me, so I had to leave.

My experience at PetSmart.  The employees are welcoming, concerning, and supportive.  The schedule is flexible.  I learned a variety of skills needed for the store to be successful.  the management encourages employee success.  The workplace and culture is fantastic.The hardest part of the job was when I tried to work as a groomer.  I was not successful at that so the manager found what I was successful at.  The most enjoyable part of the job was the interaction with customers.

They offer room to move up in position just to get you in there and promise to promote you. Then they give promised jobs to family or friends. There is too much politics going on instead of crunching down and getting work done.

Offers a great work wife balance with benefits and many incentives outside the salary . The company offers  opportunities for advancement and creates an inclusive environment for associates. Of course being around dogs all day is a plus.
Fun place to work at but manager has favorites and makes u feel your not doing a good job. The job is pretty easy with decent pay tho, this job Is mostly for students.

Really loved the campus and on-site benefits (cafeteria, animals at work, many events) and the culture is one of the best in the Phx area.  However, some managers were not very seasoned and spent most of day chasing issues which did not need detailed oversight or micro-managing by saying you can do something the way you want.  Then, they turn around and take your work away and night and change everything just for you to find out in the morning.  This happened multiple times.  Not all teams are like this, but my mgmt chain was definitely an all or nothing, 'good 'ol boy' team.  Nothing about capability & results, more about if they like you or not.  I saw this many times also. Just be careful and suck up to the boss hard if you feel you are on the outside.  Some managers over-react to minor situations and lose site of the primary goals.  some managers continue to grow your responsibility to a point were you are doing other peoples jobs and your manager plays it off as "because I said so".  Inexperienced/immature middle mgmt approach.

If you want to work for a company who doesn’t care about its employees this is the place for you!! I have worked here multiple years and I can tell you this place is going down the drain. I’ve been through 5 different managers since first starting here. Nobody wants to work for this place because the management is so very poor. Every single manager I’ve encountered only really cares for a paycheck and not their employees. Makes sense since that’s where all the money goes, cut hours and spend that money on already overpaid managers  Do yourself a favor and work for a place that actually cares about its employees

PetSmart is a wonderful establishment. You learn a lot about all kinds of different animals. If you are a lover to all animals then PetSmart is the place for you. The only down fall is the pay, hours, and depending on the store, the management. It is a part time job and you would only be payed under $10. The managers are the ones that have a full time position making way more than the associates that do most of work anyways.They hire so many people that your hours get cut. You’d probably only work 2-3 days out the week. PetSmart is more of a side job. Not one to make a living out of. All the work that the associates put in aren’t paid enough for the work they do. All the cleaning, rude customers, and knowledge thats needed isn’t being paid enough to do.

Petsmart isn’t the greatest place to work. It depends on your management but mostly everyone looks out for themselves and ceos couldn’t care less on how crazy a store is they won’t give you hours to staff the store.

I, personally, loved working at petsmart and would definitely go back. I met so many dogs every day and I got to care for the animals on the floor. The customers were some of the best I've experienced in retail which is always a plus. The only thing that was particularly hard was when I had to keep myself from taking all the animals home with me.

I was given way too little hours, didn't feel respected, my requests to be put back on pet care were constantly ignored. I was working once or twice a month, they would not give me more hours even though I asked.
Working with pets is therapeutic for me. Customers can be rude at times but never stoped me from doing my job. Its a good job if you like animals. I enjoy it.

This company has laid people off due to Covid-19 who have been employed for 20+ years with the company. They don’t care about worker rights. They don’t give raises. You do 5 different jobs for the pay of slightly above minimum wage.
the typical day pre covid19 was pretty simple joyful and simple with some easy to difficult tasks now that covid is a thing it had gotten very stressful

Pet Care department is overworked and underpaid. They are given very little time to do a long list of important tasks. They are required to know a lot of information and to care for many different animals. Pay is low for the amount of work you have to do.

There’s times when I feel defeated when pet parents clearly do not care for their animals but it’s definitely rewarding when someone listens to your advice. People at register can be stressful and complain about things that at my level I have zero control over.

This was a great job. I would go back to this job. Great pay great benefits and the supervisors and hr departments wants everyone to succeed. They also have great vacation periods and will allow as much ot as you need .
I would load and unload shipment I would get shipment ready to be shipped to costumer and other locations would also restock shelves would learn other skills to

Probably my favorite job that I held, I worked there for over 2 years after all. I loved worked around animals, and my coworkers were a lot of fun. The place was also really good at working with your schedule. Unless it was holiday season, you almost always got times you asked for off, and even then they tried their best to work with you. The only big downside with working there was that higher ups kept constantly cutting down on hours, and there was the occasional manager who had a hot temper that would cause people to end up quitting. By the time I left, the majority of people that I had started with had left, and now that I'm gone, there's like 2 people left there that were there when I was, and they're in the grooming salon, which rarely changes staff.
Go I at 4am to Work the truck and get out at 8am the job is an ok gig..only problem is people take advantage of people kind heart and they really show no care in people’s feelings but there self

The people are mostly great .It can be very demanding .Working well with people is a must no fear of reptiles and rodents and some knowledge is helpful .willingness to work many hours is often needed .Easy going management

I was literally thrown in after only a few days of being there, and this was back in February when things were calmer and less busy. So they had the time to train me, they were just lazy. Then when stuff hits the fan and people go crazy with shopping, I don’t know how to do certain things or I’m making mistakes, then they have the audacity to get mad at me

My experience at PetSmart.  The employees are welcoming, concerning, and supportive.  The schedule is flexible.  I learned a variety of skills needed for the store to be successful.  the management encourages employee success.  The workplace and culture is fantastic.The hardest part of the job was when I tried to work as a groomer.  I was not successful at that so the manager found what I was successful at.  The most enjoyable part of the job was the interaction with customers.

I enjoy my job. That is, I enjoy what I physically do. I don't enjoy the fact that, especially during quarantine, corporate is more concerned with offending the poor customers who don't want to wear masks rather than protecting the safety and health of its employees. It's disheartening and inhumane. While most people I have worked with are awesome, I've become very resentful towards my store leaders for doing absolutely nothing about one particular employee who is neglectful of her work and the animals and leaves all of her responsibilities for the rest of us to do. And trust me, there is a *lot* to do. I feel tired of being underappreciated. Burnt out, is the best way to describe it. I've been one of their longest employees now, and I still barely make above minimum wage. I don't even break even. Thanks, Petsmart.

Job was good I got promoted quick but the company got rid of my position and had to lay me off. if you  love  animals it is a very good and fun job u interact with animals and customers that love pets.

I worked there for about 7 months in the salon customers were great and there was good Business but I felt like I was treated very unfairly by some of the other employees and by management I left there with no right ups or slapped on the wrist I was just told to leave the company

While the culture and overall attitude of my coworkers was pretty great at the start, it is very empty and draining work. Over the almost 3 years I was   there, I watched the entire call floor become more corporate and controlled, and watched all managers who went to bat for the agents moved elsewhere. With managers in it for themselves alone, I was let go during the Covid-19 outbreak with almost no communication and they reported my leaving as a "voluntary quit" to unemployment.

Managers expect way too much from employees in a small window of time, even more than corporate lays out in the job description. Corporate standard is 1 pallet every 45 minutes. My store got 8-14 pallets on each truck, and I was only scheduled 4 hours per day. I kept with the job for 6 months trying my absolute hardest, usually getting almost done each time, until I was laid off due to COVID. I only ever got one shirt from them as well. This company does not care for its employees.
I enjoyed working with the people and animals. Managers are very nice and always willing to talk and help you out I'd they can. Environment was nice and pay was decent.
I was going through a tough time at home and I expressed these situations to my employer. Not only were they understanding they helps me find purpose through helping others.

As an assistant manager, expect to do the job of the customer service leader and inventory management leader.  I was supposed to be the hiring manager but the store manager was too busy hiring deadbeat workers and ignored any recommendations of good workers.  He also on sat in his office, playing games on his phone or face timing his wife.

Overall the management showed preferential treatment to how they perceived beauty in the employees.  Management show little care for employees' safety and spoke in a derogatory manner.  I do not recommend this job for anyone out of high school. I enjoyed helping customers and their animals they brought in. Management lacked common  courtesy to their employees,  Workplace culture was dog eat dog.  Hardest part of the job was not being valued.

As with any large corporate business you are just another cog in the machine. Petsmart is wonderful to get your foot into the grooming world but I do not recommend staying more than 2 years. Management is is always going to be money driven and push you to over work yourself. I had to use all of my vacation pay when the salon shut down for covid and later when I came into contact with someone who had covid and had to quarantine myself. They are constantly enforcing rules that only make your job take longer while simultaneously asking you to take more dogs. “Rush to take more dogs... but safety first!” Doesn’t make sense. The fast food of grooming. It’s alright when you’re young... Fine tune your skills here and then move on.
My experience there may have been short but it was very enjoyable. it was a great place to work. Great people and they helped no matter what the problem was.

When i first started working there, I loved it. I enjoyed interacting with customers and giving advice on pet care. The manager of my department was 100% there for the animals. There was a change of management and the new person in charge did not care about the animals at all. she cut corners and put sick animals back on the floor. she would tell us we had to give false information to the customers. Information corporate would give us, which was not accurate pet care information. I refused and put in my two week notice. This is reflective of my own personal experience working in one store. Not all store may be this way.
This job is the most boring job I’ve ever had, the management is very nice but the other cashiers are all very rude. I would only recommend working here if you do not respect yourself.
Not a good place to work. The manager never followed store policy. He would change it to fill his needs.  I would nog recommend this compazny to future applicants.

Store is great as far as hours and pay but  advancement  is difficult not friendly to older employees  who are more than qualified to advance to different positions  and who dedicate all their time to job  been there for 4 years and watched younger less experienced get offers to advance and cant because I’m old  many safety violations I’ve reported nothing been

I’ve had many managers over the years, and they all interpret the rules differently and expect things to be done their way, which I understand- but I’ve had the same role for a while and I have figured out what works.  Also, my current managers are inflexible to my requests regarding working hours/days.
No matter how the day started my coworkers would always make sure that our day ended on a positive note. I will always remember and cherish those that I worked closely with.
The department i worked in was full of cliques. The rest of store was great. But this was years ago. I hope it improved since working there. Work ethic meant nothing to the department manager.
Pushed into grooming.. Recieved my grooming license despite not knowing what the heck i was doing and was always booked the most difficult dogs by the other groomers

The company has changed so much that it’s hard to be happy there now. They continuously push you to work harder for less money. They do not fairly compensate their employees for the amount of work they require now.

My experience at PetSmart.  The employees are welcoming, concerning, and supportive.  The schedule is flexible.  I learned a variety of skills needed for the store to be successful.  the management encourages employee success.  The workplace and culture is fantastic.The hardest part of the job was when I tried to work as a groomer.  I was not successful at that so the manager found what I was successful at.  The most enjoyable part of the job was the interaction with customers.
Hot and humid for the workers and the pets. Black mold on the ceiling tiles where the pets board. Not enough workers to clean up the fecies in the kennels in a apprioate manner etc...

The animals are not properly kept. The advice given for animals is not good enough. Upper management only cares about sales. You can and will be fired over dumb circumstance. Customers at some locations are toxic and a lot of the customer service for animals is that the customer is always right, but with petcare that is far from the truth.
A typical day at work would be making sure the animals were ok. Help anyone to walk through the doors. And to be gentle when it came to the animals. .

While in college I worked at the petshotel. It was very long hours and lots of cleaning. A lot of people just get hired and they don't care to do their share of work which will eventually catch up to other shifts. The overnight never cleaned kennels making a good hour of cleaning when you first start. Work every holiday. My direct boss in the hotel was amazing. Store managers revolved, the last one I had was a nightmare. She relied on others to do her scheduling, payroll, supply ordering. Her ops manager was cool though.
If you wanna work hard they don’t want you there.

I started when they first opened in the Midwest. I worked there for twelve years as their dog trainer; #1 in top-grossing training sales every month of every year fo the twelve. The only reason I stayed that long is it was a commission job. With the above numbers, I assure you that I not only made a lot of money BUT, I made enough that corporate left me alone. I was the reason the 'current' store director, district & regional managers got their yearly bonuses, so they left me alone as well. Most trainers left after two to three MONTHS! Why? Because they couldn't produce the 'numbers'. Why? Because management wouldn't leave them alone. Why? Because corporate wouldn't leave management alone.
Loved working here! As with any retail job the hours aren’t always favorable but it’s a fun place to work! The team was great and always worked together to get the job done.
Good management, nice people, able to work around a busy schedule, fair pay, overall a fun place to work, especially getting to see all the puppies!!!

It’s good if you’re a college student, all the managers try to be nice and understanding, but you must come to them with your needs. Job can be fun depending on what you do. Customers can be cool most of the time unless they don’t understand the needs for their pets.

During covid it has been pretty rough. Working with a skeleton crew, and starting to get very busy is a bit stressful. However, the company in general is great. They truly do care about the animals and that is refreshing. Fun place to work as long as you don't mind bugs or handling small animals or birds or fish.
It has all the pit falls of retail . Everyone is over worked and unhappy. Customer base  seems to be particularly petty in this industry as well but you do the best with what you have.

Managers are essentially do it all employees that have to clean up animal feces, push carts, and operate registers—all while running a store with minimal resources and heavy pressure to meet unrealistic KPMs from upper management. Company often does not have managers/employees back when employees have encounters with unreasonable and disrespectful customers—whom frequently demonstrate abusive and belittling  behavior. Customers tend to treat employees terribly and let their animals  defecate all over, and then expect you to pick it up (which you will have to). Overall, employees are treated poorly and hours are all over the places. Managers have to schedule employees for a couple hours here and there and crazy times (2AM-6AM, 4AM-12PM, you name it, it’s all in the table). Everyone at store level is abused and taken advantage of, while the cooperate SSG (Store Support Group) thinks of silly ideas for stores to try to implement. In store teams are barely marking ends meet with minimal resources and little or no appreciation. Company always wants things done better and more sales(way more), but they don’t want to pay for more employees or hours. Cooperate employees, DMs, RVPs, and SSG folks love do surprises visits to criticize and intimidate, and they have an attitude of arrogance and superiority. If there’s an up coming executive visit, or if there’s possibly the store receives an audit; you will work more hours, under higher stress than you could probably imagine. It’s a demeaning place to work. If you can avoid it (which I couldn’t), you should. Keep looking, this place will
Love learning about pets and pet food. Fun job to get started in the pet industry. Get to see dogs every day and interact with people who share your interest in pets.
Generally thought it was a pretty good company for today's job market. Found out the hard way that they do NOT treat employees right. Corporate SUX!!!!
It is actually pretty good. I really enjoy working with the animals. I enjoy the hours as well! It’s pretty decent job if your looking for a second job or just for some extra money
The salon is a stressful environment but the floor is a great place to work. In the salon dogs always get taken off of you, so you don’t get dogs then get in trouble for not doing any.

Best for entry level or part time job seekers who hold multiple jobs or are also going to school.  Super flexible with your schedule, friendly coworkers, great team, supportive managers. Animals are the highlight of the job (as an animal lover).

I'm an Assistant Manager at Petsmart and my Co workers have been amazing. I am paid very fairly as well, my issue is with my boss the Store manager. She often prevents people from taking breaks, and uses fear tactics to make people listen. As a person she's wonderful, but to be leading a Petsmart she is failing and workers have mentioned it to me as well.
Care for associates has went down the drain over the years and I’ve worked at several locations that have poor management that do not lead by example or encourage associates.

It's entirely up to managers how much you like your job. I loved my basic tasks of cleaning habitats and assisting customers, even with the occasional difficult one, but management changes made it unbearable. The company as a whole started prioritizing in-store animals as a whole and the management really makes a difference on how well theyre vared fir store tonstire.

My experience at PetSmart.  The employees are welcoming, concerning, and supportive.  The schedule is flexible.  I learned a variety of skills needed for the store to be successful.  the management encourages employee success.  The workplace and culture is fantastic.The hardest part of the job was when I tried to work as a groomer.  I was not successful at that so the manager found what I was successful at.  The most enjoyable part of the job was the interaction with customers.

I worked for PetSmart in the PetsHotel for about 6 months. While I was there my duties included taking care of the cats and dogs boarding, supervising playtimes, feeding the animals, and general cleaning duties. The animals were really the best and only good part in working there. The downside at my store was the management team. They very rarely communicated with one another so if you told one manager something then the chances were that the rest of the management team wasn’t going to hear about it. For example: I was injured on the job and I informed the manager on duty what had happened. When I called later to say I was going to have to seek medical treatment the manager I spoke with had not heard I had been hurt and then proceeded to try and bargain with me about coming in since they didn’t have their act in line with the staffing. I went out on comp for a couple weeks while my injury healed and when I came back I gave the note to another manager who lost it even though I watched her take a copy. I was later injured again when the manager on duty that night failed to tell me there was an issue with some of the equipment. Between the repeated injuries, the lack of staffing, the poor equipment upkeep, and so many other issues, I ended up leaving. It’s good as a side gig if you need the money and you love animals but the management was awful at my store.
Though they have a propensity for promoting bad managers, the environment can still be positive. There are a lot of good employees. Management suffered when the company was bought out by bank firm.

It’s a good starting out job. You learn about the pets that are sold and how to properly care for them. The best part is seeing a little one come and get their first fish or hamster. If you don’t mind varying hours and little pay it’s not the worst place to be. Management is all over the place. Too much talk, too little action
The animals themselves create a very positive calm and exiting work experience everyone seems to equally care about the stores maintenance and finding all pets a home.

Like with any company there's the business side of petsmart And it must be balanced with With the interactive part. that being said the interactive part with pets and their families was the most enjoyable I had any job.

I was very excited to start working at petsmart because I love animals and was excited to be working with other people who love them too. Boy, do I wish I never worked there. The “training” I received was about 2 hours of staring at a screen and taking quizzes and then 2 shifts of shadowing other workers (who hardly explained what they were doing). Then I had to open the pet care department completely on my own at 6 in the morning. Working with the animals was fun and cute at first until the first shipment of animals who came in tiny boxes terrified and sick. So many animals died, some in my arms. To make matters worse and more depressing, I had a manager yell at me, telling me it was MY fault that the animals were dying (I was probably the only person there who tried to take good care of them). The management was incredibly rude and condescending, even made me cry once (and frequently made another manager cry). When I needed to cut back my hours due to schooling, they consistently over scheduled me and told me they’d cut back my hours If I did my work better. The majority of my coworkers were also kind of “cultish” and very judgmental towards me and I felt like a total outcast. To put the icing on the cake, I got ringworm from one of the sick guinea pigs ON MY FACE! I also got very very sick and was berated by one of my managers for not being able to come in and I ended up just quitting. Do yourself a favor, don’t work here.
TLDR: I was a cashier for 2yrs, got laid off cuz of Covid-19, could not collect unemployment cuz I didn't make enough hours.Thanks for nothing PetSmart.

It is a good retail job however it is not perfect. Lots of tasks to complete in small amounts of time. Time management is key. This is a team effort, to keep the store and the animals within acceptable standards.

I worked at Petsmart for about a year and it had its regular ups and downs, such as bad customers and good animals to work with. Personally I thought they focused way too strongly on the customer aspect, not taking into account that we sell living breathing animals that need attention more than that full grown adult that could easily google her question. Covid19 hit and this company showed its true colors. They didnt change their hours until state mandated, no paid time off, no hazard pay, they didn't even limit customers in store or enforce the people to stay away from us. No one was required to wear a mask and we were only cleaning once a day if even then. Also, this awful company cut half of its staff down using Covid19 as an excuse, and ran us ragged. We were making more profit than ever, were as busy as black Friday, but every single day. And they decided it would be a good idea to cut staff to save money. That money going directly to the CEOs pockets since none of us were given hazard pay, and anyone who was given a raise recently had it revoked. I could go on and on, but long story short, on a small scale your store would be fine, but the company as a whole doesn't give a **** about you.
Fun environment (who doesn't love seeing puppies at work every day) good people, who are supportive.  Always something new to learn and ways to improve.

Management sucks, poor pay, and they play favorites. Worked 5 years and they kept giving the hours to the new people. You’re expected to do more sales than full time employees in the span of five hours.

If things don’t get finished on a day shift and grave didn’t have time it’s there fault.  They were constantly under minded.  The manager gossiped like  no other. It felt uncomfortable. I felt stuck on graveyard. I didn’t wanna be on graveyard. Who does. I’m a hard worker but felt undervalued. Eh typical graveyard. Even tho who else is gonna work that horrid shift?

It's an okay place to work. The pay isn't bad, but the raises are nearly non-existent. The longer you work for the company, the more they begin to take you for granted. Local management is pretty standard, but corporate, is corporate.

As a corporation goes, Petsmart is better than most. Our store management tries to make us feel like a team and a family. Retail operations are retail, rarely much nice in retail! We get discounts on purchases and a 50% discount on house brands. That's great. Holidays management buys us great food !
I loved working here as a pet care lead years ago. I felt valued for my hard work and care for the animals and customers.  I was very happy here. I didn't have any bad experiences here.

Horrible company that cares about nothing more than getting more money in their pocket. Will throw their employees under the bus to get that. Dosen't care about the well being of the animals they sell, will sell to people with no cages, for carnivals, horrible set ups, you name it. Treats their groomers like garbage. Dosen't care when they seriously injure a dog and let's the groomer keep grooming dispite multiple of the same injury type and drives the good groomers into the dirt by pushing them to take more and more dogs in a day until they litteraly breakdown and get hurt due to stress.

It was so fun working with and taking care of so many different animals every day i worked! Customers are usually nice and even fellow employees are very welcoming as well! If you want to work with animals but need a flexible schedule, PetSmart is the place for you!

When i first started i had fun but they truly dont pay enough for what you have to do and they do not stand up for employees. also the biggest thing is how they handled covid-19 pandemic ..... terrible

Maybe we're just lucky, but our management team is excellent. I have worked in the Hotel for about a year now. Our clients can be a pain sometimes but I am there for the animals. The company supports and donates time and money to animal adoption and charities. I love working here. My favorite job I have EVER had in 28 years of working.

If you love all types of animals you'll love working here. Other than that, it's a relaxing low key place to work as a retail associate. Managers and Team Leaders are put under very stressful work conditions with demanding management.

My experience at PetSmart.  The employees are welcoming, concerning, and supportive.  The schedule is flexible.  I learned a variety of skills needed for the store to be successful.  the management encourages employee success.  The workplace and culture is fantastic.The hardest part of the job was when I tried to work as a groomer.  I was not successful at that so the manager found what I was successful at.  The most enjoyable part of the job was the interaction with customers.

Horrible management, even district leaders don’t have your back. The regule associates are expected to do a lot but management does not help at all. As a store leader I tried to help and implement respect. But no luck.

If you enjoy working with animals and people it's a fun place to work! Co-workers are super friendly! Customers can sometimes be a bit difficult however petsmart has a good balanced policy of taking care of customer happiness as well as employee happiness (for example I worked in the grooming salon and if a customer wasn't happy we would offer a discount next time fix anything we were able to etc. But of the customer was overly rude such as cussing and yelling and treating us badly we could deny them service in our salon). The pay is not competitive with other shops, but it's a good place to start a grooming career. Being a team player is valued and will get you a long way with your co-workers. Especially in the salon we all always need help at some point. It's hard when you're new and just learning and you need more help then you can give, but helping where you can will make others with more experience more willing to prioritize helping you when needed. Over all I loved working at PetSmart.

I spent my time here while I was earning my associates degree. Flexible hours and great team to work with HOWEVER I will say that atmosphere changes from store to store as I have helped at several locations.

I like to just come in to work and do my job right and correctly and be safe and always be aware of your surroundings I want to do the best job I can with no drama and when my work is finished then just go home I’m actually working in a mailing place right since January 2020 as a machine operator

I loved this job, it was the perfect job to have during college. In the beginning (2018) there were the best managers, but since I left the management has spiraled downhill. My old coworkers have mostly all quit because the managers that corporate sent were so ruthless and belittling. I hope they got new management because it was so fun working there and petting animals, and talking to people about their pets everyday. The people that worked there were down to earth and friendly. Also that was just the Chico location so who knows. Working at a pet store is a great experience especially as a first job.

The only reason I stayed at the petsmart pets hotel was because I loved the animals. My coworkers were awful, management sucked, we never had the supplies we needed, something was always broken. On multiple occasions I left work in tears because of the way I was treated by coworkers and one of my managers- they were all bullies. One of my managers even had a group chat with some of my coworkers in which they just gossiped and talked about other coworkers. She has multiple complaints against her and nothing ever happened. The job itself was great, but the environment and treatment I had to deal with were awful.
It was a fun job if you love animals. Management wasn’t good. All drama was brought out. Some managers were rude and so many quit. Store isn’t organized and pay isn’t good
The job itself was decent. It wasn’t to hard, but the lack of pay( especially during this Covid-19 ) sucked.  Seniority doesn’t really get you anywhere and the customers can be rude at times

Working here was both challenging and rewarding. The managers were very passionate, productive, positive and patient. This company has a system that leaves all of its associates on the same page as far as procedures and tasks go, and they really advocated for team effort and unity. Comstmer service was always excellent and you also got to work with animals!
I am dedicated to finishing my tasks properly and on time, and i work hard to finish my work and do it thoroughly. I care about my quality of work and how it reflects my work ethic.

Best job ever. They teach you in a very good way how to handle dogs with care, and how to properly bathe them, how to properly do their nails as well as drying them out and taking care of any other thing they need. 10/10.

pay is sub-par.  during the coronavirus pandemic, almost all other retailers gave pay increases to those who continued to work petsmart did not even give employees a stick of gum in fact the laid off almost all employees but continued to pay peanuts to those to stayed and in fact increased our workloads to make up for those laid off.  Petsmart cares about the bottom line ONLY it is bad enough they are so overpriced but to have employees risk health and not even get a thank you
All they want is money and don't care about the employees. They never give you a compliment for a good job and all the management plays favorites and fried me after 11 years.
Pros: You can bring your dog to work with you
If you love dogs and can spare a few days of your week, I highly recommend working here for a while

Everything that happens is your fault and the customer is always right. Management is never on your side, and you are made a fool of in front of customers just to make them happy. The Store Manager knows nothing about animals and regularly says things to grooming clients that are untrue. Management will almost always give out free grooms/discounted grooms for any tiny problem a customer might have instead of backing up the groomer.
Management style was positive and consistent for employees. Guidance for new employees. Team work, fair pricing and associates were trained and trained again. I highly recommend this company.
I ended up leaving because I had no car and no transpiration I have a car now and insurance I can drive to any job u offer me .

They work you like a dog then fire you for any justifiable reason. Not to mention they promise a bonus for performance but keep in mind they will take hundreds from you for the small technically. Petsmart doesnt not care about you anymore then Walmart.
It was ok. I started there with a bright and happy outlook on the general public and it slowly went down hill. The customers are crazy and you grow accustomed to it eventually lol.

My experience at PetSmart.  The employees are welcoming, concerning, and supportive.  The schedule is flexible.  I learned a variety of skills needed for the store to be successful.  the management encourages employee success.  The workplace and culture is fantastic.The hardest part of the job was when I tried to work as a groomer.  I was not successful at that so the manager found what I was successful at.  The most enjoyable part of the job was the interaction with customers.

It is fast pace but  you get to say hi to most of the animals coming in and out. The staff is great to work with. All the personalities are great. Managers are nice there. When you work there you are there to help pet parents and their partner (Pets) find what they need. The difficult part was selling Puppy Guides but other than that It is a fun place to work.

The coworkers are fantastic, the work itself is not bad, but the company does not give any thought to the day-to-day operations of the place. This place rarely prioritizes the animals and when they do so, it is at their convenience.
Unfortunately, it is clear right off the bat that sales will always come before animal care here. Management was typically friendly and work environment was pleasant, though.

In the salon production / speed/ income per ticket is more important than the groomers physical well being. You can break your body quickly and that's irrelevant to the higher ups, I've heard many salon/ store/even regional managers be asked about changes but it's on deaf ears.

Petsmart petshotel is a great place to work. The pet parents are great, the animals, and the staff too. I loved working there. I got really attached to all the animals who boarded and came in for day camp

Worked there 2 years out of necessity.  Would never go back. Working there is like going back to some immature high school gossipy place. It's so annoying.  On top of not getting paid faily, which is the #1 reason I'd never consider working there again.

Like many jobs I’ve worked at, this was a really great place to work but I had a manager there that stressed me out and at times could be unreasonable. I talked to coworkers and they said people usually quit because of her and I soon understood why

This by-far has been the best job I've ever had. It's so much fun seeing all the cute animals and getting to help customers who love animals just as much as myself. The management at my location was the best management I've ever had. They were not just my co-workers they were my family and we all looked out for one another. It was a true healthy, energetic, and caring environment. I truly loved this job more than anything.

I came to PetSmart after working as a waitress for 3 years and working other retail stores that work u to death. PetSmart offers way more to their employees as a company vacation, 401k and other healthy benefits. It's also a place u can actually advance in if you put in the hard work. And hard work it will be. I've gotten injured and my back's definitely suffering but it's a rewarding place to be. You will deal with a lot of ignorant customers who know nothing about their pets, but u take the good with the bad.

I enjoyed the job very much and loved learning more about animals daily. However my low ratings are mostly based on me being hired as a pet specialist, and ending up spending more time behind a vash register. I had made clear that i could not do that as i have back issues yet they would force and only schedule me to work register 90% of the time. Not employee friendly.

Workplace is great, if you enjoy a good workout. You work independently majority of the day. The order fill workers are all good company and easy to work with, most don't bat an eye when they need to lend a hand. However, the management is questionable. It is hard to enjoy working with people who pretend to take you seriously, act like they care or simply don't listen to you. It almost seems like if you're not making your production consistently by month 2 you're as good as useless but its also no different for the people that do make their production. The motivation and moral boost management provides is as good as nothing. It's also best to keep any concerns or issues to yourself seeing as they will either target you or completely dismiss you. I do believe that for every person hired, there should be a brief examination of the persons' capabilities and place them where they can actually be successful regardless of who was wherever first. Iv'e personally never seen a company like this who tells you everyday they want you to be successful but then when you express how you feel about the work your doing, especially if you know you can preform exceptionally somewhere else, they just simply dismiss it and tell you you're not doing your job right or that you're not working hard enough. The only benefits that I can acknowledge are the discounts and being in great shape, so long as you don't sprain anything or bruise any bones.

I'll start by saying that I've worked with some fantastic people at PetSmart, and that my coworkers make my experience there better than it would otherwise be. This includes but isn't limited to management at the store level. The problem at PetSmart is the company itself & the customers. The company does not care about it's employees. They don't care about employee safety or morale. It is a completely profits over people mindset. Employees are not heard at all when it comes to designing more safe & effective procedure & protocol.  They push employees beyond capacity and it benefits neither employees or customers in the end..

While at work (in grooming) you are constantly told to either do better or groom more animals, all while the managers actually have no clue how to groom or what a typical day of grooming consists of. Pet smart is a money hungry corporation that cares nothing for their employees and will fire anyone without hesitation. If you are passionate about animals and have a commitment to them then you should find anywhere but this corporation to work
PetSmart is a great place to work! The culture here is like no other and the possibilities of advancing are endless. The management team are always willing to help.
I worked at the Outer Loop location. I loved working with dogs and making friends with the regulars. My coworkers and salon manager were all funny and relaxed.

Petsmart had the greatest work enviroment the staf and management were helpful and friendly. They did daily reviews and check ups you always had someone checking to see if you were ok or needed help just overall great place.

I had an overall great experience while working with Petsmart. My employees were helpful and fun to be around. I started as a cashier and worked my way up through the company as a bather and ending as the pet trainer. A typical day in my work life as the pet trainer was keeping in touch with my pet parents are making sure my curriculum was up to date and I was ready to teach a class four days out of the week. The most enjoyable part of my job was spending time with my furry friends and helping the pet parents train their dogs.

I had some good days at Petsmart but a lot of bad days. The head manager is very against LGBT+ people and many who were LGBT+ quit due to him. Praise isn't given very often and many gave up trying to do their best work. I loved some of my coworkers! The coworkers are very friendly and willing to help. The head manager will avoid helping staff with upset customers and will not follow company rules. Managers also tend to ignore/blow off any lower staffs opinions. Managers/leads in the grooming and hotel were awesome though!!! Hopefully things will get better there, but you have to be willing to just stick to company rules and policies even when told to bend the rules a bit by management. Specific managers to keep an eye on is the Store leader and secondary leader/scheduler.

Management is terrible. People that don't deserve to be promoted frequently get promoted. Associates are often poorly trained and receive no support. People that clearly deserve to be fired somehow manage to avoid any consequences despite multiple write ups/complaints. The company bends over backwards to kiss up to customers, even when they're wrong or it goes against policy. I liked my coworkers, but I can't recommend this company.

As a "Pet Care Associate" for 3 and a half years. I can say that I love the actual work. Making sure everything is in optimal condition for the animals in our care is worth the low pay. However, when you realize that on a corporate level the animals' well-being is at the very bottom of the priority list, it gets pretty discouraging.

My experience at PetSmart.  The employees are welcoming, concerning, and supportive.  The schedule is flexible.  I learned a variety of skills needed for the store to be successful.  the management encourages employee success.  The workplace and culture is fantastic.The hardest part of the job was when I tried to work as a groomer.  I was not successful at that so the manager found what I was successful at.  The most enjoyable part of the job was the interaction with customers.

I enjoyed my work a typical day would be some of the employees happy  to see you. No one passed on word of what needed to be done as far as changes. Then there were other managers that were Moody  and what about your head off . The hardest part of my job would be  having customers not respect your space  and being rude to you . I love my customers most of them were very nice and courteous and kind .  Price be there but you hardly ever saw the main manager.
I loved working here because of the animals. And they are very important part of the job as well as the pet parents. We make sure the animals feel safe.

one of the major issues i had was that petsmart cuts hours drastically throughout the year. The most you'll really work is sometimes in the summer, and the holidays. The only full time positions (at least at my most recent store) were only for managers. So if you're looking for a seasonal job this would be great. Even as a part time stocker i was only getting up to 10 hrs a week at one point.
my favorite part of the job is seeing puppies and dogs come in and my regular customers asking for me by name..what could be better about the job is more hours and pay
The management at Petsmart is amazing. They very hard to try and accommodate you and your life into their schedule. They like to try their best to work with you.

If you love pets and dealing with the public like I do, this is a great place.  Awesome for the younger crowd.  If you're looking to get your feet in the door, this is the place.  You're always busy so there's no slacking.  They promote if you work hard.
The fact that the opportunity to advance in PetSmart lies in the hands of stand out and acheivements along with working alongside great co-workers.Thomas. The gm is one great person.
As a seasonal employee in the PetsHotel, there was always something to do. The work wasn't especially stressful or hard, and management at the branch I worked at was great!

I was so excited to work at PetSmart but quit after my first day. They wouldn’t give me a schedule when they knew I had another job. They wouldn’t even work with my schedule because there’s other employees. They didn’t want me to do anything but cashier and just stand at the register when there’s no customers (makes no sense). I offered to help management but they said no. If they want to pay people to just stand   that’s on them. I can’t work like that. I never got paid either or uniforms. I wanted to do grooming but I’ll never go back again.
There's a lot of work( mostly under pressure), be prepared to work overtime, full weekends and in some cases holidays. The company is good, pro employees, the managers are not the same case....
I think about some the animals I formed a bond with during my time with PetSmart that I can't even remember my co worker's names. I would send my pet happily knowing they are on camera 24/7.

I enjoyed working at PetSmart for the most part. It was only part time for me until I finished school. I liked learning about the care and comfort of all the different kinds of pets and providing that care for them while I was working.

My bosses at Washington PetSmart are absolutely incredible. They care about their associates and the animals and pets that enter our store. Great associate relationships and passion for people and pets.
The most enjoyable part of the job is the pets.  Workplace culture is very stressful and co-workers lack professional demeanor.  Management is not properly trained to handle salon challenges

Fun place to work for those who love pets. Its a great place to start to get your foot in the industry as pretty much any job there is a great skill to build off of. My favorite part was the pets and helping the pet parents new and seasoned find what they are looking for. Management was not great at my location, which was a downside and promotions were hard to come by which is my reason for low stars. Overall however, I did not mind my experience here.

I worked at PetSmart doing a small number of things. Unfortunately, since I was good at one particular thing, that made me one of the only people to do it. I often helped to train new people doing the job I did as well. There wasn't much room to expand past what I worked as and it got quite lonely because more often than not, despite being around my fellow coworkers being the best part of the job, no one wanted to be near my post, since it was possible that they could be sucked into doing my job as well. The best part of the job for me, however, was the regulars. They were always friendly and told me about their days/weeks and asked me about my own week. I highly recommend, if you do work at a PetSmart, find those friendly regulars you can look forward to serving.

This company has been the best job I've ever worked at. I love working here and would like to try and get back into the company. Even though the pay sometimes sucks, it's still a great place to work at. I have met some of my best friends within this company and the best manager I have ever worked under.

I don't know if this is just my specific store but, I will say that it was a hard place to work. If I tried to communicated I'd get shut down or talked over and if I tried to focus on work it never felt like I was getting any direction or help. I wouldn't say it is the WORST possible place but, it can be challenging if you would like actual direction or leadership or even just a place where you can discuss issues openly without the worry of being told its your fault you feel that way.

The managers are bullies and do not care about their employees. Only about money and the customer whether or not the customer is in the wrong. I have been verbally abused by customers and then essentially told it was my fault and I deserved it, the manager in the salon bullied me and constantly and had her own policies that were very dangerous to the pet and the stylist.

I was always able to learn something new. Everyday was a new experience. Customer service is something I love doing, so engaging with the pet parents and they’re  pets was a fun experience. I like to also mention for the 4 years I was there, my customer service, management and team building skills have improved.

My experience at PetSmart.  The employees are welcoming, concerning, and supportive.  The schedule is flexible.  I learned a variety of skills needed for the store to be successful.  the management encourages employee success.  The workplace and culture is fantastic.The hardest part of the job was when I tried to work as a groomer.  I was not successful at that so the manager found what I was successful at.  The most enjoyable part of the job was the interaction with customers.

Was treated very unfairly. They decided to remove me from the schedule and not inform me I was being fired until my last day. Their reason for firing me was that I was lazy, though I cleaned the whole salon and did all of the reminder calls when the other salon associates went home early. Was not trained for the job I was given and told to train a new bather, who constantly stopped me from my job to help her, but no one would stop to assist me if I was in need of help. The manager who hired me promised monthly reviews to ensure I did well but she quit and her replacement was disrespectful.

I have had great experiences and less than great experiences at PetSmart stores depending on the managers at the specific stores that I was working at. If you have a great team that's willing to support their staff no matter the cost, it's a fantastic job. However, you can also get managers with little experience in the company who focus too much on numbers to make themselves look good, and the store culture suffers for it.

I worked at Petsmart for about a month or so before I couldnt take it anymore. I was trained for one day on how to handle dogs in daycare, I knew nothing about what I was doing basically ever. Dogs were moved to different cages without telling anyone which resulted in multiple dog fights and attacks to people on the team. The team and management was rude and had no compassion for their members having a life outside of work. I was told not to ask for vacation time because I wouldnt get it. I left work everyday crying and couldnt take it after a month.
I was in love with the animals even though I did overnight stocking. All the employees came in ready to work and we always got the job done regardless of circumstances.

Working for petsmart was one of the best decisions I made. It led me down the career path as a dog groomer. I left working for them because a manager would not allow me to pursue the business I wanted to.

The people were really nice and helped you learn from your mistakes. I learned to be efficient, but also careful because you are dealing with customer's pets. I extremely enjoyed playing with the dogs in day camp, but I also loved keeping myself busy with all the tasks that needed to be done. I also learned how to manage and train new employees.
When I first started it was great. Once management changed in the store and in the salon it was not good. It's a high volume salon you have to keep up.
Had a great time with customers and the pets,  work could be demanding at times.  Mangers open door policy was nice if issues arose.  Some mistreatments of certain store managers caused some issues.
Loved working here! Great company, great employees! Everyone was friendly and got to see dogs everyday. Great for animal lovers. You learn a lot! You can take that knowledge anywhere you go!
Petsmart is a great place for pet lovers to work and shop. You get to work with and around animals and animal lovers. But unless your a manager or groomer you'll only get 10- 20 hours a week.
A typical day at work really doesn't occur.  Each day has its own duties and/or events.  I work as a cashier, pet care specialist, and my main duty is as Pet Trainer.

Working in the grooming salon at Petsmart was very enjoyable and rewarding. It's a very fast-paced environment most days, as I was always doing my own work as well as helping others with theirs. Management was reasonable and generally fairly understanding.
Personally did not like working at Petsmart. Customers were unhappy when I could not help them with vet related things. I don’t mind working in retail.

It was a fun place to work at. Some guests were difficult to work with but the management was usually always on your side. During this pandemic, the corporation did not give us hazard pay but expected us to wear mask but never provided masks. Was let go because of seniority yet a coworker of mine got to continue to work even tho she was hired 3 months after me.

A typical work day is about 7 hours and starts with being with the daycare dogs for the first few hours and then you start walking all individual dogs. After walking and feeding dogs you would start cleaning kennels.

A good 1st job or pet job for people trying to get into a pet field. Managment was always understanding and always helpful. Work culture was pretty chill and always felt like you alway had someone there to help you if you needed it
Are you like my job because it is so much fun and I like to see people I can like joke around sometimes I do my job seriously and I get things done on

Everyone who works here is a like-minded animal lover, so there is a real sense of community among the employees, even between the different areas of the store. And the variety of customers and pets who walk in the store make the work environment a very interesting place to be. I love working back in the hotel,where I get to watch over the dogs and cats who are staying there.

I work for this company for 10 years and at the end of that 10 years after all I had done building and training thier #1 salon team in the district and region along side the Store director of the #1store They brought in a new district manager from some grocery store somewhere who knew nothing about the pet industry on the retail side let alone on the  Service side Out of nothing but jealousy the corporation let him tear the whole team apart

I have served in two separate locations and as far as retail corporation go this one is doing a lot of right. There support from both leaders and corporate that are consistent in sharing the same objective with our 'pet parents'. This helps for both the customers and the associate for clear communication and conversing in objectives. Friendliness is highly encouraged and tends to keep a positive environment within the store and through its ability for employees to accomplish daily task. The structure is clear to whom is to hold responsibility in the store along with how that role affects the efficiency. In smaller store environments it becomes an easy way to be close nitch team. Its not best for pay, mostly being around minimum wage for part-timers but a lot of growth is supplied and local store leaders get to give managing opportunists to others from different backgrounds because of the role guidelines. The pay and benefits at a leadership level are much better then the part-timer.

My experience at PetSmart.  The employees are welcoming, concerning, and supportive.  The schedule is flexible.  I learned a variety of skills needed for the store to be successful.  the management encourages employee success.  The workplace and culture is fantastic.The hardest part of the job was when I tried to work as a groomer.  I was not successful at that so the manager found what I was successful at.  The most enjoyable part of the job was the interaction with customers.

even before the pandemic, it sucked to work here. they don't hire new people often and when they do they're only trained on register or stocking. pet care at my store has dwindled to 3 people now, including myself. there's only one pet care person on shift at a time. we're the only ones who can get crickets and feeder fish, catch fish and pets to sell, and the only ones in the store that can troubleshoot customer problems with their tanks or pets. not even managers can answer any questions about pet care, because they don't know and aren't bothered to learn. no one in the store is able to assist when pet care gets busy, and we do get busy. on a regular Saturday, i would have to catch crickets, catch feeder fish, process a cat adoption, assist a family wanting to get a reptile for the first time, figure out why another customer's fish are dying, catch more fish, all in the span of a half hour, and all by myself. it gets overwhelming because I'm the only one in store that can do any of this, and when i ask for help while its happening or in general (more cashiers cross trained, more pet care certified employees), I'm treated like i should be able to handle it by myself, like i shouldn't need to pull managers away to help me for 10 minutes to thin out the crowd. if i need help with anything, I'm on my own.
It was a place I always felt comfortable showing up to and looked forward to my shifts. The other staff members are reliable and management is very approachable.
Management are snakes don’t trust anyone there they will use it against you  bad hours for workers and they are all stuck up  you get hurt they want you to go home and not report it

My store was very welcoming to those of the lgbt community, but lacked in other aspects. 1 manager to be specific, nothing you did seemed to please him but cool guy to talk to if you were talking sports. It was clear that they were only there to work and nothing else

Management is horrible. They told me that wouldn't work with me with my school schedule and because I signed a contract, I had to quit school... I have been told that my grooms are trash and told to " just quit" to my face. They won't work with groomers and force them to do more work than what they should. I had to put my dog down every 15 min to answer a phone or do a walk inin.inRidiculous and

Was a bather in the grooming salon for 2 years. Of course all my co-workers were women. Most of them were very catty and talked behind eachothers back, including the manager. Even some arguments and yelling.
Grooming experiences it all depends on your groomer some are amazing and wonderful to the animals and others are not so you just have to make sure to stick around and keep your eyes open

Would never recommend.  Promised much more than what the reality was.  No flexibility.  Poor morale.  Terrible pay.  High turnover for a reason.  Raise potential is promised but never given.  Always a reason for the lack if pay.  Expected to over perform in unethical ways.  Forced unachievable goals.  This includes how many adoptions your location is responsible for.  Miss adoptions and you will have to be on "outlier" calls that punish leaders.

It would be a lot of customers that would treat their pets like children, they really had a strong emotional attachment to their pets, and would always be treated like family when they stepped foot in the store.
Have patience and love animals. Also enjoy assisting customers. Working at PetSmart isn't a job it's a community for people with the love for pets and animals.

PetSmart could be an amazing company IF you have the right management staff. I was a manager at a previous location and loved every minute of it! But I also had an amazing team with the will to help others than themselves. I left the company for a year to advance my career and actually came back but to a different store. Only lasted a year and I was in the same position as before! Store manager was a joke. Very shady and so is the DM. Be warned.

I cannot speak for every grooming salon I have worked at a total of 3 and this review is only in regards to the last one. Management when I first got there was very lax and did not support my salon manager who had just become a salon manager and transferred there, the team did not respect her or her ideas. This made the work vibe very difficult. Then we got a new store manager and he backed up my salon manager but also was very forceful with his tactics saying Petsmart owned us and we would do what we were told to do... needless to say that did not end well. Then the teamwork was divided because there were a lot of favorites play in the salon so if a person did not like you they just would not help you leading to anything but stress and anxiety and a little bit of adult bullying. About 3 people quit and 2 transferred. For the good things about the job as soon as you become full time you get two weeks paid vacation and you do get sick days, the insurance was pretty good and not very expensive but an HMO at the time I worked there.
Flexibility is great. Nice company to work for. They worked with my very specific schedule and treated me like family. I loved working with the clientele.
Definitely a positive work environment with others promoting you challenge yourself to do better. Loving community, every customer comes in with a smile and if not they will leave with a smile.

Fun animals to work with while keeping you busy, the only downside is having to clean up constantly after pets (dogs to be specific) after they used the restroom. Overall a enjoyable work environment if you are strong willed and and a passion/love for animals.

As a seasoned pet care associate, my store managers have always been vocal about their appreciation for my work and I maintain a good relationship with them to this day. However, after working for the company for 4 years and consistently being one of the only people to finish daily tasks correctly and go above and beyond when it comes to animal welfare in our store, I have not received a raise in over 2 years. I only make 6 cents more per hour than a new hire, and for the amount of irate customers and sick animals that I have to deal with, it's just not worth it anymore. The fact that PetSmart corporate holds customer reviews over the welfare of its animals and its employees is too much to cope with, and I am not compensated fairly for the work that I put into this company.

I liked my supervisor and co-workers.  Didn’t like working different shifts most everyday.  Loved being around animals everyday.  Pay scale was low and stagnant.  Everybody but supervisors were part time.  So no benefits or perquisites.
good part time job for college students to work at. Manager is great. Communication could improve but t hey have been very flexible with my schedule which is great.

I loved working at Petsmart my favorite part was the animals in grooming they all had crazy funny personality. I would have to go in to help a groomer safely put a big dog on the grooming table.I love how the big scary looking dogs are the biggest babies. If you love animals this is the place for you and a crazy discount on pet food.

You take care of dogs. Not a whole lot to it but keep in mind to anyone looking to apply it's not as easy as you think there are many animals who are dependent on you and this environment can often get overwhelming to some who are not ready to commit to the responsibility of this job.
